title: Carrot, butterbean and caraway dip
time: Hands-on time 15 min, oven time 15-20 min
description: ”The brilliant orange of this dip is wonderful and the taste is gentle and fragrant. We love it topped with crunchy dukkah and served with grilled flatbread.” – Jane Muir, founder of Mildreds
ingredients: 75ml olive oil, plus extra to drizzle

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 180°C/160°Cfan/gas 4. Line a baking tray with non-stick baking paper.

method.Step 2: In a bowl, toss the carrot slices with a drizzle of olive oil, the orange juice and a pinch of salt. Spread over the baking tray and roast for 15-20 minutes or until tender. Remove and allow to cool slightly.

method.Step 3: Toast the spices in a dry frying pan over a gentle heat for a couple of minutes, stirring, until they release their aroma. Remove from the heat, then grind in a pestle and mortar or spice grinder.

method.Step 4: Blend the carrots and spices with the remaining ingredients, except the dukkah, in a blender or food processor until smooth. Transfer to a bowl, drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with dukkah to serve.
